suppress.notes:
Long-lived suppression, probs not going away anytime soon.
Suppress this CVE that is a wontfix from spring because it is about how spring provides a java deserialisation and invocation endpoint implementation that if you expose unauthenticated would be risky. They argue that's a you (app) problem.

Long-lived suppression, probs not going away anytime soon.
Spring-framework libraries always have groupId org.springframework with no further extension, so suppress the spring_framework package identification for old and third party libs that merely include spring jars

false positive as spring boot uses safe constructor in snakeyaml, see:
https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/33457
file name: snakeyaml-1.33.jar
false positive CVEs not related to package

6.5.0 version is only used by spotbugs who do not exercise vulnerability:
https://github.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/discussions/2251
file name: bcel-6.5.0.jar
false positive CVE-2021-4277 is not related to package
false positive CVE-2021-4277 is not related to package
false positive CVE-2021-4277 is not related to package
false positive CVE refers specifically to hutool not this aws package file name: json-utils-2.18.41.jar
false positive CVE refers specifically to hutool not this aws package file name: aws-json-protocol-2.18.41.jar
false positive CVE refers specifically to hutool not this package file name: jackson-core-2.13.4.jar
vulnerable code not in use within project, no fix available as of 17/04/2023 file name: guava-31.1-jre.jar
